stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on Course 14 (working title “Handmade Heights”) implementing three new interactive elements: a realistic paper-plane ride to reach the pyramid section, an elastic rubber-band slingshot, and a cardboard Toad that dispenses a star. He simultaneously tests the upcoming public demo on real N64 hardware, refines performance with the new F3DX3 microcode, and discusses upcoming YouTube content and project philosophy.

development_findings.summary: Paper-plane object created for Course 14; physics tuned using face_angle_pitch, forward velocity, gravity, friction and sine-based scaling so that the plane ‘swoop-swoops’, can perform optional back- or front-flips, loses speed when climbing and regains it when diving, and finally lands on the pyramid to act as a traversal shortcut.
development_findings.quote: You want it to move like a real paper plane – we want it to go swoop, swoop.

development_findings.summary: Spawn point and initial speed of plane adjusted; plane should stop movement once it touches the pyramid, effectively making the pyramid a landing pad and entry to its interior.

Rubber-band slingshot programmed; uses a Blender bone animation that stretches forward for 7 frames, then snaps back to propel Mario. Discovered Fast64 ‘smart animation range’ bug that discarded frame 1 keyframe; workaround was to insert a dummy frame before export.
development_findings.quote: The first animation frame wasn’t exporting because the smart animation range feature cut it out – I had to keyframe frame 0.

development_findings.summary: Cardboard Toad NPC implemented; spawns a star after dialog. Dialogue rewritten to sound deliberately mechanical. Toad size exaggerated for stylistic effect.
development_findings.quote: Visitor detected, dispensing star. Take it.

development_findings.summary: Breakable paper targets finished off-stream; shatter when hit by Mario’s face. One additional cannon added to the level.

Upcoming public demo considered ‘all done’; Kaze fixed N64-specific rendering bugs (coverage*alpha seam lines, background Z-ordering) and added toggleable anti-aliasing. Demo now reaches ~50–60 FPS in heavy areas.
Engine now uses F3DX3 microcode, new occlusion plane, triangle strips; project is RSP-bottlenecked but gains speed from those optimisations.
development_findings.quote: F3DX3 is in the game now… my game is RSP bottlenecked.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 contains multiple biomes (desert/pyramid, styrofoam mountains, castle grasslands). Current tentative name: ‘Handmade Heights’.
Analysis videos planned for every course to aid the forthcoming ‘remix’ phase; Course 2 video next, Course 4 & 6 acknowledged as less refined.
development_findings.quote: I want to have the videos done before the remix exists – it’s more time-efficient.

context_findings.summary: Kaze routinely does significant off-stream work and values time-efficiency.
He believes even limited daily time is enough for progress and criticises excuses about school or work.
context_findings.quote: School is like six hours a day… you have all the time you want, you’re just being a pussy.

context_findings.summary: Strong scepticism toward current AI coding assistance; feels it has regressed.
context_findings.quote: AI used to be better at programming but at the moment it is absolutely horrendous.

context_findings.summary: Keeps strict schedule—wakes at 8 AM daily to manage workload and energy.
context_findings.quote: I always wake up at the same time, which is 8 o’clock.

context_findings.summary: Birthday is the day after the stream; may host a bonus ‘birthday special’ stream.
Frustration with Twitch chat’s repetitive or premature questions; openly reprimands viewers when distracted.
context_findings.quote: You are asking way too many questions about a feature that’s not even done yet – shut up and wait.

context_findings.summary: Considers Analogue 3D N64 clone ‘probably bad’ if company won’t send early review unit; plans review video either way.
context_findings.quote: If they’re not sending me one there’s a reason – surely that means it’s garbage.

biobak.summary: Appeared briefly in chat; no direct task reported in this stream.

zeina.summary: Joined chat during rubber-band work; Kaze notes he is ‘not the animator’, implying Zeina will polish the animation later.
zeina.quote: I’m not the animator for this game anyway – I just need a decent base so we can make this work.

key_stories.title: Taming the Paper-Plane
key_stories.summary: Kaze spent the session wrestling with chaotic maths to make a paper airplane behave believably. He iterated through gravity values, pitch limits, friction, and sine scaling, fielding impatient chat questions, before finally achieving the desired swooping path.
key_stories.challenge: Initial physics caused infinite spins or stalls, never landing where intended.
key_stories.process: Added constant tipping force, limited face_angle_pitch, introduced sine-based acceleration and friction; repeatedly adjusted spawn point and forward velocity while live-testing.
key_stories.outcome: Plane now performs smooth swoops and optional backflips, loses/gains speed correctly, and nearly reaches the pyramid landing target.
key_stories.key_quote: At this point I’m just fucking with the numbers until I get something decent.

key_stories.title: Rubber-Band Export Bug
key_stories.summary: While animating a rubber-band slingshot in Blender, the in-game object refused to start in the stretched position.
key_stories.challenge: Fast64 cut off the first animation frame, so the band appeared unstretched and Mario wasn’t launched.
key_stories.process: Debugged by printing animation states, discovered ‘smart animation range’ removes leading frames without keyframes, inserted dummy keyframe, re-exported.
key_stories.outcome: Slingshot now stretches for seven frames and snaps back, ready for force calculations and sound effects.
key_stories.key_quote: The first animation frame wasn’t exporting because the smart animation range feature cut it out – I had to keyframe frame 0.

open_questions.topic: Final naming and thematic intent of Course 14
open_questions.context: Kaze floated ‘Handmade Heights’ but no decision; level has multiple craft-themed biomes.
questions: What final name have you settled on?
How do the biomes tie into the overarching narrative or aesthetic goals?
Why choose a craft aesthetic for this course specifically?

open_questions.context: Plane nearly lands on pyramid; intended to stop on contact and serve as traversal.
questions: Will the plane always guarantee pyramid entry or can players steer?
How does the mechanic scale with player skill or speed-run strategies?
What fail-states are planned if the player misses the landing?

open_questions.context: Base animation finished; physics force and sound effects still missing.
questions: What final force values and trajectories are planned?
Will Zeina add secondary motion or squash-and-stretch?
How will sound and haptic feedback be handled on real N64 hardware?

open_questions.context: Game now RSP-bottlenecked; uses new occlusion plane and triangle strips.
questions: What specific gains has F3DX3 provided over F3DEX2?
Are further microcode or culling optimisations planned?
How do you balance visual fidelity against real-hardware limits?

open_questions.context: Demo ‘all done’; Kaze debates separate social accounts vs using his own.
questions: What is the concrete timeline for the public demo?
How will you leverage existing audience while targeting non-ROM-hacking players?
Any contingency plans for Nintendo legal action?
